block.p: M.T.A. Proposes Many Fare and Toll Increases Metropolitan Transportation Authority officials proposed a sweeping list of fare and toll increases and cutbacks yesterday that would affect nearly everyone who drives or takes mass transit in the New York region. Most prominent were changes in the price of unlimited-ride MetroCards.

Iraqis Defer Conference Aimed at Reconciliation Iraq postponed a major national conference intended as a step toward democracy and reconciliation as a spate of kidnappings widened with the seizure of five more foreign hostages. The new insurgent tactic adds another challenge for the fledgling Baghdad government.

Plan for Electronic Trades A new plan could allow big blocks of shares to be traded electronically on the Big Board's floor, according to people who have been briefed on the plan.
Tracing Roots of Mad Cow Researchers announced a finding on proteins that might support a controversial theory about the roots of mad cow disease.
Suspect in '98 Bombings Held Pakistan officials seized Ahmed Khalfan Ghailani, who is suspected in 1998 attacks on two American embassies in Africa.
Paranoia All Around Jonathan Demme's update of ''The Manchurian Candidate'' and M. Night Shyamalan's new film, ''The Village,'' are reviewed by A.O. Scott.
